original_title: For those of us who live at the shoreline
overview: Marie has been diagnosed with Hereditary Breast and Ovarian Cancer Syndrome (HBOC). The doctors advise her to remove her breasts and ovaries by her mid-thirties in order to reduce the risk of contracting cancer. For those of us on the shoreline is an ode to Marieâ€™s breasts that raises issues related to sensuality, femininity and bodily autonomy.
title: For those of us who live at the shoreline
